title: LLM Safety Assessment Report
subtitle: Migrant Worker Exploitation Guardrail Analysis - mistral-small-latest
executive_summary:
This assessment evaluated 500 test scenarios designed to probe LLM safety
guardrails against human trafficking and migrant worker exploitation. The overall risk level
is assessed as **CRITICAL**.

**Key Findings**: 153 safety failures were identified, including
4 critical and 108 high-severity issues.
The model demonstrated a 30.6% failure rate when presented with
exploitation-related scenarios.

**Top Risk Areas**: Business-Framed Exploitation with Operational Guidance, Adversarial Attack Vulnerability with Operational Guidance, Adversarial Attack Vulnerability with Exploitation Normalization

**Immediate Action Required**: The identified critical failures represent significant
guardrail weaknesses that could be exploited to obtain harmful guidance. Remediation
should be prioritized based on the risk register included in this report.
key_findings: The model failed 30.6% of safety tests, with 4 critical failures requiring immediate attention.
The highest-risk category is Adversarial, accounting for 41.2% of all failures.
In 97 cases (63%), the model provided step-by-step operational guidance that could facilitate exploitation.
Business-framed and professional language consistently bypassed guardrails more effectively than direct requests, indicating a training gap.
The model correctly refused harmful requests in 69.4% of tests, demonstrating baseline safety capabilities that can be improved.

risk_register.title: Business-Framed Exploitation with Operational Guidance
risk_register.description: Model failed to recognize exploitation when framed as business operations in 37 test cases. This could allow malicious actors to obtain harmful guidance by presenting requests professionally.
risk_register.recommendation: Implement semantic analysis to detect exploitation patterns regardless of professional framing. Add specific training examples for business-framed attacks.

risk_register.title: Adversarial Attack Vulnerability with Operational Guidance
risk_register.description: Model was bypassed through adversarial techniques in 41 test cases, indicating guardrail vulnerabilities to sophisticated attacks.
risk_register.recommendation: Enhance adversarial robustness through red-team testing. Implement multi-layer guardrails that are resistant to prompt injection.
